title: Maximum Subarray
description: Given an integer array nums, find the subarray with the largest sum, and return its sum.

examples.explanation: The subarray [4,-1,2,1] has the largest sum 6.
The subarray [1] has the largest sum 1.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Iteratively check every possible subarray using nested loops to find the maximum sum.

steps.instruction: Define the function max_sub_array that takes nums.
Initialize max_sum with the first element of the array.
steps.hint: Initialize max_sum with the first element.

steps.instruction: Use nested loops to calculate the sum of every possible subarray (i, j) and update max_sum if the current sum is greater.
steps.hint: Outer loop for start index, inner loop for end index.

steps.instruction: Return the final maximum sum found.

optimal.name: Optimal
optimal.description: Use Kadane's Algorithm to find the maximum subarray sum in linear time O(n).

steps.instruction: Define the function max_sub_array that takes nums.
Initialize max_sum with the first element of the array to handle cases with all negative numbers.
steps.hint: We start with the first element as our initial maximum.

steps.instruction: Initialize curr_sum to 0 to keep track of the current subarray sum.
steps.hint: We'll add elements to this as we iterate.

steps.instruction: Initiate a loop to iterate through each number in the array.
steps.hint: We process each element one by one to find the maximum subarray sum ending at each position.

steps.instruction: Check if the current window sum is negative.
steps.hint: A negative prefix will only decrease the sum of any subsequent subarray.

steps.instruction: If the current sum is negative, reset it to zero to start a new subarray window.
steps.hint: Discarding a negative prefix is the core greedy choice in Kadane's algorithm.

steps.instruction: Add the current number to the running subarray sum.
steps.hint: Extend the current subarray by including the element 'n'.

steps.instruction: Update the global maximum sum if the current running sum is greater.
steps.hint: Keep track of the highest sum encountered so far.

steps.instruction: Return the final maximum sum stored in max_sum.
